newsitem.title: USA: Texas power prices ease slightly following natgas.
newsitem.headline: Texas power prices ease slightly following natgas.

text.p: Wholesale power prices in the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) eased slightly Monday following behind lower natural gas prices, brokers and marketers said.
"We're following natural gas pretty closely again today," said one ERCOT trader.
Swing natural gas in the Permian Basin was quoted at $2.56-2.62 per million British thermal units, down from near $2.68 on Friday.
Peak, firm power for Tuesday delivery was talked lower at $27.00-29.00 from Friday discussion at $29.00-31.50 per megawatt hour (MWh) for Monday delivery, the brokers and marketers said.
Off-peak ERCOT power for Tuesday delivery was pegged at $13.00-15.00 from a range of $14.00-17.00 late last week, the sources said.
December peak power was talked steady at $24.25-24.75, while January/February ERCOT power was talked at $25.25-25.50, the sources said.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
